org.minueto
Class MinuetoOptions

java.lang.Object
  org.minueto.MinuetoOptions

public class MinuetoOptions
extends java.lang.Object

The MinuetoOptions allows a programmer to activate experimental features in Minueto. For these features to work, they should be activate early when the Java application start, especially before any other calls to Minueto are made. In addition, once these option are set, they should not be changed. All the features found here are Expiremental. Be careful when using them.

Since:
1.0

Constructor Detail

MinuetoOptions

public MinuetoOptions()
Method Detail

enableAlpha

public static void enableAlpha(boolean value)
Allows a programmer to enable alpha transparencies. Please note that this will dramaticly slow down the application unless the JVM uses some kind of acceleration.

Parameters:
value - boolean denoting if alpha transparencies should be turned on.

isAlphaEnabled

public static boolean isAlphaEnabled()
Returns true if alpha transparencies are enabled.

Returns:
boolean indicating if alpha transparencies are activated.

enableOpenGLAcceleration

public static void enableOpenGLAcceleration()
Enables OpenGL acceleration inside Minueto. If you are using Linux or Mac and have video drivers properly installed, this is a good option for a speed boost.

To function, this should be one of the first call in your application.

Never enable OpenGL and Direct3D acceleration at the same time.

enableDirectXAcceleration

public static void enableDirectXAcceleration()
Enables DirectX/Direct3D acceleration inside Minueto. If you are using Windows and have video drivers properly installed, this is a good option for a speed boost.

To function, this should be one of the first call in your application.

Never enable OpenGL and Direct3D acceleration at the same time.
